control.name: 6.5.3 - Do not use insecure cryptographic storage
control.desc: Applications that do not utilize strong cryptographic functions properly to store data are at increased risk of being compromised, and exposing authentication credentials and/or cardholder data. If an attacker is able to exploit weak cryptographic processes, they may be able to gain clear-text access to encrypted data.

test.steps:
6.5.3 Examine software-development policies and procedures and interview responsible personnel to verify that insecure cryptographic storage is addressed by coding techniques that:

  • Prevent cryptographic flaws.

  • Use strong cryptographic algorithms and keys.
